sentences.en: But in 1993 the startling answer is that a shutdown by banks might be cataclysmic.
sentences.cn: 但是时至1993年,令人吃惊的答案是:银行倒闭可能无关痛痒.

sentences.en: But the gradual build - up of underground pressure can lead to occasional bursts of cataclysmic activity.
sentences.cn: 但是随之逐渐增长的地面下的压力可以引起偶然性的大变动的爆发.

sentences.en: Few had expected that change to be as cataclysmic as it turned out to be.
sentences.cn: 没有人预测到那些变化会变成一种大灾难。

sentences.en: Had that occurred, the consequences for every area of our economy would cataclysmic.
sentences.cn: 一旦出现彻底崩溃, 对我们经济中的所有领域都将造成灾难性的后果.

sentences.en: However the risk and cost of being able to grow your business the alternative, is cataclysmic.
sentences.cn: 然而,企业增长乏力的风险和成本同样巨大.

sentences.en: If, say, the Western Hemisphere were sterilized , there would soon be a cataclysmic spiritual crisis.
sentences.cn: 打个比方, 如果西半球的人们无法生育,随之而来的将是严重的精神危机.

sentences.en: It all happened with the speed of lightning and with cataclysmic violence.

sentences.en: It most likely happened after a cataclysmic comet or an asteroid impact 65 million years ago.

sentences.en: Laotse had laughed before him, a thin , shrill yet cataclysmic laughter.
sentences.cn: 老子在庄子面前嘲笑他, 那笑是尖锐刺耳却又激变的.

sentences.en: This paper presents a Cataclysmic Genetic Algorithm for optimal reactive power planning of power systems.

sentences.en: We found evidence of a cataclysmic climate shift, which occurred 10,000 years ago.

sentences.en: Worldwide, people are fascinated with a purported Mayan prophecy that predicts a cataclysmic event in 2012.

words.tran_cn: 灾难；大洪水，地震；（社会政治的）大变动

trans.tran_en: A cataclysmic event is one that changes a situation or society very greatly, especially in an unpleasant way
